intro: Bonnaya pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf bonnaya, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Bonnaya pusilla prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or containers.
